alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of through 415 PM MDT... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of La Sal. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of . This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 83 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
